entry.title: How do you ask good questions?
entry.summary: Ryan writes to me: Consuming the different variety of media in which you publish ideas, Iâ€™ve noticed that you pose very high quality questions. For me, high quality questions have a Heideggerian quality insofar as they open a space for exploration, i.e. a concept, category, path of thought has specific affordances that were merely dormant [â€¦] The post How do you ask good questions? appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: The Pandemic JOLTS
entry.summary: The 2009 recession was big but it followed a very familiar patternâ€“job separations were a little bit larger than job hires and this lasted for a little less than year which drove up unemployment rates. Unemployment rates then declined slowly as hires became a little bit larger than separations. Now look at the pandemic recession! [â€¦] The post The Pandemic JOLTS appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: v1.11.0
entry.summary:
Added: support an experimental template for YouTube feed ðŸ“º Demo | Source
Aggregate content from any YouTube channel rss url https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=<replace_with_channel_id> Videos are embedded via iframe and loading accelerated by youtube-lite-embed Ads are reduced thanks to YouTube's policy for embedded videos ðŸ™ƒ Works on mobile devices with butter smooth horizontal scroll. Caveat: the template works only with YouTube content. You cannot mix textual RSS feed or other video sources such as Vimeo. Changed: Default HTML template meta tag adjusted to match convention Changed: sources in template data is now ordered by last update timestamp (as opposed to alphabetical) Thank you @PiyushLosalka
